title: Delhi Trade Fair 2025: Dates, Ticket Prices, Entry Timings, Theme, How To Book, and Other Details
text:
Delhi Trade Fair 2025 Dates, Ticket Prices, Entry Timings and Theme: The 44th India International Trade Fair (IITF), one of India’s largest and most culturally engaging exhibitions, will take place at the Bharat Mandapam at Pragati Maidan, with the theme ‘Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat’ for 2025.

Jitin Prasada, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry, launched the exhibition on Monday, kicking off a 14-day event that will run until November 27th.

Delhi Trade Fair 2025: Date and Timings

The first five days of IITF, i.e., November 14 to 18, are exclusively reserved for business days. It will open to the general public from November 19 to November 27, with the timings of the fair being 9.30 AM to 7.30 PM daily.

Delhi Trade Fair 2025: Ticket Prices and How to Book

Adult tickets cost ₹80 on weekdays and ₹150 on weekends, while children’s tickets cost ₹40 and ₹60 on weekends.

Senior citizens and people with disabilities can enter the fair for free.

Visitors can purchase tickets from the official website. Fair tickets can also be purchased at 55 Delhi Metro stations and through the ‘Saarthi’ app.

Step 1: Go to ITPO’s official website, indiatradefair.com.

Step 2: From the home page, click on the ‘Buy Tickets for IITF 2025’ link.

Step 3: Enter your mobile number to register.

Step 4: Enter the OTP sent to the same mobile number.

Step 5: Before proceeding to the checkout and payment, select the ticket category and quantity.

Delhi Trade Fair 2025: Metro Route and Traffic Advisory

The Supreme Court metro station serves as the nearest stop to the venue.

Further, the Delhi Traffic Police have warned commuters of anticipated traffic congestion on roads near Pragati Maidan, including Mathura Road, Bhairon Marg, Ring Road, Shershah Road, and Purana Quila Road.

Non-visiting commuters should avoid these routes or choose alternate routes to guarantee smooth transport.
